review: It was fine. A Sunday afternoon shopping and we drove past it. My daughter suggested we eat there. I said I had never been, so she said, "we're going!" We sat quickly even though it was pretty packed. Many families, lots of kids, I guess I was expecting something a bit more upward but, no matter. We ordered several apps, a steak quesadilla, a big salad and some mini tacos. All were fine. The main courses were Pizza, of course. Pear and Gorgonzola, yummy. ubiquitous BBQ chicken, again fine. Nothing earth shattering, but pleasant enough. The server was pleasant but oh, so slow. Apparently, they need more wait staff. When we did get her attention, I mentioned the wait. From then on she hurried so I am guessing it wasn't her fault, just too many tables and too many demands.  Perfectly acceptable. Enjoy!
This place is overall good. The only downside is that it is usually packed so the wait can be quite a bit.

Went shopping Westchester Mall, on our way back  home took central ave a little hungry saw CPK and decided to stop for a snack, we were told we have to wait 20 minutes and we did wait  outside with other peole because inside it was packed no room to wait gave our name to be called waited over 20 minutes or so and we were wondering why are all these other people being called  before us and we were here before them and we walked inside to ask what is going on, we were told that i guess when they called our name someone else inside answered to our name and we were still waiting outside they were pretty nice, and kind of skipped us in the matter of 10 or 15 minutes they got us sitting. I think they should find a better way of calling people if they have that many people waiting either get their number and text them like some City places do or give Buzzers and Buzz them when the table is ready like cheesecake factory does. My wife ordered a 5 cheese pizza and i order the Penne with pesto sauce and chicken, Wifey did not like the pizza at all it was very soggy on the bottom it looked like they didnt dry the plates before they put the pie on it and not tasty at all, my pasta was aldente the way i want it but there was so much cream on it than pesto sauce the chicken i didnt like at all very small pieces, u littly had to digg in and look for them. AND TURN DOWN THAT AC IT MUST OF BEEN 35 DEGREES IN THERE.   I wouldnt go back there again  Service and the  waitress was great her name was Maria thats why im giving it 2 stars just for the service but food wise -1
very good place went there today i would recommend it but today unlike any other time i went there i had to wait a long time for the food to come! But overall its an awesome place! Cheers!

I'm not a fan of writing reviews of chain restaurants but I decided to make this one of my exceptions.  We started off with the Spinach Artichoke Dip.  I had the California Club Pizza and my boyfriend had the BBQ Pizza.  The artichoke dip wasn't anything special and I really enjoyed my pizza but then again, I love anything with avocado.  This place is a refreshing alternative to your typical greasy pizza and it's way better than the fast food pizza joints like Pizza Hut.

After hearing so much about this place, and having passed it several times, we ventured out in the snow on Saturday evening and got there around 6. The decor is nice, and considering the weather was pretty full. It's nicely lit, music was ok and it's clean. I like the open kitchen too, having worked in the industry, it's always nice to have a nose and see how things are being run these days.  The menu is pretty good with a lot of delicious looking and sounding items. My friend opted for the thin crust cheese pizza and I opted for the Kung Pao Spaghetti with Chicken. The place was quiet, there were a few tables in, and yet, the service was cat. Our waitress was very inattentive and when our food arrived, my friend had no utensils. She was eating a pizza but still.  My Kung Pao Spaghetti was ok. It was spicy, but there was just no taste of anything off it. I've had this happen in the Cheesecake Factory too. Just no flavor. Very disappointing.  The dessert menu is pretty BLAH so we just got the check. Not impressed and won't be back.
I just had the pepperoni pizza at Greenburgh Nature Center. This might be the worst pizza I've ever had. The crust was doughy and very sweet.  The rest was just very bland.
Very cozy space. We were seated right away and had a light and delicious lunch that consisted of crispy mac' and cheese as well as the spinach and artichoke dip. I highly recommend.

I've been coming to this CPK with my husband for years. It's a solid 4 star for what it is. I'm taking the one star off because the tables are a little squished together. The staff are the best - it's a well oiled machine. Wine list is decent. Great to come in here for a quick, cheap bite. I'm a Hawaiian pizza fan myself, and it's consistently done well every time.

Went here for my father's bday dinner. 4 adults, 4 kids.  Our server, Maria, was great. Very attentive & friendly.  She got anything we asked & was pleasant despite our kids being a bit all over the place. Habanero Carnitas pizza, dumplings, aspargus salad, arugula salad, artichoke & spinach pizza were all delicious.  Kids menu is very inexpensive so you can't go wrong w a mini pizza, drink & an ice cream sundae for a mere $6-7. A great place for families that has good food & not our typical chain restaurant microwaved foods!

Yall bastards done closed the one on the Upper East Side... but you know what, I'm not even mad. This California Pizza Kitchen is a well-oiled MACHINE! Nicely decorated, though a little tight. The hostess at the entrance was very friendly and sat us in barely five minutes on a Friday night. Our server, Mike, commented on how nicely my boyfriend and I were dressed and stated that we were the best dressed couple in the restaurant and proceeded to speak to us in an Australian accent for the rest of the night. Not even joking... but it was hilarious. This has the regular menu of a California Pizza Kitchen but to my diet-riddled delight, a "New Adventures" menu with choices under 650 calories. I ordered a shrimp scampi pasta with fresh zucchini and garlic. It was surprisingly good and not too salty! We also shared the Chicken Tinga quesadilla which was crispy and wonderfully cheesy. Also, unlike the one downtown, they gave us yummy warm bread and olive oil.   (we walked from the 20 bus stop a few blocks down, mmkay). Of course, it's a chain restaurant in the middle of Scarsdale... you know there's going to be kids, but it wasn't a chaotic scene at all.
I love coming here because we can all individually get want we want and still count on good food.

You can still order the tricolore salad even though it is not on the menu.  If that changed, I would not like CPK as much (take note management).  Service was good, no line at noon on a Sunday and that salad pizza is consistently good.  It is the only thing I order for my entree. The mac n'cheese fritters are not lightly fried as the menu states. Hummus dip is delicious.

We came here twice in the past few years. The first time was nice. We both had the spinach-asparagus spaghetti with salmon. We both finished ours completely. The second time was the standard chain restaurant makes you regret returning routine. We had the spinach-asparagus spaghetti which was bad. There was a random splash of alfredo sauce and we did not finish it. The Hawaiian pizza was very bland and had no taste. I tried pouring on the parmesan cheese which did not have any taste either and I really poured it on. Our server really could care less about us and he had no problem showing it. We were ignored the whole time (minus the obligatory one time stop to ask how is everything). We had water and coffee and never got refills. He rarely walked by and when he did he never looked at our table. We went during lunch time and there were 3 tables total including ours. We had to wait awhile to get our plates cleared and waited awhile to get the check and pay it. He made it seem like we had to beg him to pay. "Oh please please can I give you my money?" "Oh pretty please may I pay?" "Please please please take my money." That is how it was with that long of a wait for such a low crowd. The only other explanation for his apathy is that he is incompetent and cannot handle 3 tables at once. Maybe in another couple of years we will try again if it is still open but not going back any sooner than that.

For over a decade, the Traditional Cheese Pizza was what I would keep coming back here for. And, the complimentary italian bread slices w/butter were like an appetizer for me. HOWEVER, CPK decided to make not one, but TWO fatal mistakes, costing whatever respect & loyalty I built up towards them. 1. Changing the Traditional Cheese Pizza into the Un-traditional Cheese Pizza, resulting in less cheese, less sauce, and more end-crust. BIG MISTAKE! 2. Phasing out the complimentary italian bread slices w/butter for some tiny baguettes w/olive oil. UNBELIEVABLE! Sorry CPK, but unless you can right this wrong, you're never getting anymore money out of me.

I don't really order anything else but their Waldorf salad which is so delicious, and keeps me coming back to dine-in and take-out. It is just the perfect combination of flavors and textures. I love it, and as long as they have this salad I will be a loyal customer. I've tried other things on their menu...and I'm not exactly impressed but what can you expect from a chain restaurant, really?  They're supposed to be known for their pizzas, but I think they are ok at best. It's New York for Gods sake, who goes to a chain restaurant to get pizza?  I used to love the dumplings here but they have been on a steady decline, they used to be crispy and delicious...but now they're just sad and soggy. The atmosphere here sucks, always too many kids, crowded tables...but the service is friendly...they aren't the quickest, or the most accommodating, but they are nice. I think I'm just gonna stick to takeout from now on.
My Niece and daughter really love this place went today and the kids love the pie pizza and how they cut it we'll definitely be back

Our default place for a casual lunch with the kids. Fast reliable service. Good selection of pizzas, sandwiches, pasta concoctions like Kung Pao spaghetti, Fettuccine Jambalaya, etc. Bottled craft brews, and yummy desserts. Awesome kids options including Mac and cheese ball, pizza, etc. Free soft drink refills and reasonable prices. One of my go to places.

I have been a customer of this location for many years and used to consider this one of my go to family friendly places.  The food is okay, however, the service isn't as great as it used to be.  A few weeks ago, we had a server who brought out everything we ordered (appetizers and entrees) out at the same time.  She seemed puzzled as to why we didn't want everything at once.  She also only focused her attention on the only male adult at the table which was awkward for the rest of us.  This past weekend we had a server who disappeared mid service and was replaced with someone who was definitely nice but wasn't exactly as professional as they should have been.  I'll still eat at this CPK but only as a to go customer.
My first visit and I absolutely loved the pizza. We shared the Peaches and Arugula, the Tostada, and the California Club pizzas. All excellent.  The service was as great as the food.

Love California pizza kitchen. Their food is always great and if you don't like what you ordered they will gladly take it back and give you your usual. I think the rewards program they have now sucks because no one really knows how to use it there - maybe they need to teach their staff. Would be so much easier if there was just a rewards card instead of smartphone app for discounts (CPK pizza dough). TIP: download the app before going there. Service could be iffy sometimes like they won't give you refills on drinks or forget to clean up dirty plates but asking a server usually fixes the problem so giving 4 stars cause service could be better.
This place was always good, but since the changes they've made, it's great. Service and food are always on point.

My boyfriend and I have been to CPK in California and Hawaii and to be honest this is by far the best!! Luckily, for us its the closet location! All of the waiters are so pleasant, knowledgeable, helpful, offer superb customer service, and provide great recommendations! Keep up the great work! The managers are wonderful too and always foster a friendly atmosphere and service as well. The food is always fresh, we never wait 20-30 minutes for our food even when they are busy its amazing! CPK in Scarsdale never let us down!  Always a pleasure returning and we would most likely be back soon :)

Nice restaurant. The new mojito es delcious, but the Mai Tai is really bad. The guacalome with corn is great but should be considered an apetizer. Pizza was ok not the best. For desert we had the tiramisu es so deli ious. Will go back for mojito and try the pasta.

I came here with my friend and his girlfriend and a friend of hers a few weeks ago because my friends gf suggested we eat here so I said alright since I had never been to any CPK restaurant before. I had their pepperoni pizza made with whole wheat or grain dough. I felt the pizza was bland with very little sauce and cheese and had a big crust that was tasteless as well. I probably won't be coming back to this restaurant or any other CPK location, id rather stick to mom and pop joints.

Always loved CPK (this location) and had to stop eating here due to Celiac Disease (could no longer eat gluten without getting violently ill.) Within the last year CPK added gluten free pizzas to their menu and they are delicious!  The staff at this location is great, especially Maria (heavyset waitress) - she is just WONDERFUL!

Went for dinner with my son last night and was pretty disappointed this time around. First, the lite menu offering if the chili poblano was lukewarm (given that it was Labor Day evening and the place was half full, this was inexcusable) and the surrounding greenish yellow corn sauce surrounding the dish was pretty unappetizing looking. Perhaps a dish that needs rethinking. Also it was not evenly spiced. My sobs pizza was great, and I wished I was eating his meal instead. Then, I ordered my free birthday treat if the salted caramel pudding which I've had before and lived, but being by myself this time and eating it solo I ordered it without the whipped cream and fit a half filled container. While I realized how much cream makes up this dessert, what happened to the salted caramel sauce? None! I don't get why no sauce and it would have helped an otherwise insipid looking, though still good (but no great) dessert. I expected way better for sure.

I've taken my elderly mother to CPK for an outing on a number of occasions. It's a nice convenient choice if you find yourself on Central Avenue, a good place to fuel up for some shopping (or recover from it). We're both gluten-free, so we appreciate the availability of the gluten-free pizza. I've also enjoyed the roasted veggie salad several times--artichoke hearts, asparagus, avocado, sun-dried tomatoes--all in a quality Dijon vinaigrette. Service is always friendly and efficient. With a crowd of varied customers, including kids, at lunchtime, CPK is fairly noisy, but you don't mind this when you're in for casual eating like salad or pizza. It's useful to remember that, as the name indicates, this is California style pizza, topped with items like barbeque and salad fixings. You go elsewhere for traditional New York pizza.
Can't really complain about CPK. For a chain, the food and service are consistently good. Great place for young families to visit as there are usually lots of kids.

Been here a ton of times, and never disappoints. Personally, alot of the menu items are too spicy for my liking, but they let you try anything for free. Although it's usually pretty busy, the quick service and delicious food easily make up for it. There are new products all the time, takeout, call ahead, and a wrap around bar for light fare, making it a great choice for most.

i really like cpk , its been a long time since i hit the place, fond memories of coming here with dufus twins porcelli and nunu ( what a nightmare) this time it was a weekday and not crowded seated asap. our server nice and pleasant gal, who took our order pronto. i ordered my past time fave spinach dip with nachos, it did not miss a beat, creamy and warm, like i remembered, and for entree the same like i did in the past grilled chicken pizza, i just love how its made from scratch and then taking out of the oven, with some burnt marks in the crust, just so yummy baby. after a little break, i order the key lime pie with the graham cracker crust, and my dinner is in the books. listen i am aware the menu has many other things to order for apps and entrees, but i like my routine.however i know i will be back soon and a change in menu choice will be in the cards for me. nice staff and fast service, with good food ,cpk is as they say in cali groovy dude. p.s. take out is an option in the future.

Just left this restaurant a few minutes ago and I have to say that our server Esmeralda and the manager made our experience so pleasant! They were attentive, provided excellent recommendations (yum tropical sangria!), and were overall accommodating and so nice. And of course the food was great! We will definitely be coming back. :-) Thank you!

I've been coming here for a long time and I have never been disappointed by the food or service. I do not think the food is particularly delicious but that's simply a by-product of it being a CPK. If you hang around this place long enough, you'll be sure to meet the who's who of the Westchester crowd. True story: a few years ago I met Ang Lee, the director of Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon and Life of Pi, here.
Consistent quality at this place. Decent portions and a lot of variety on the menu. This spot is clean and the service is great here. Nice family friendly chain.

Very delicious. Actually one of my favorite places around here. There was this one lady who was so kind to me and my friends  I wish I could remember her name! Their pizza, appetizers, and pasta are all amazing. My dad says other staff are not so kind. This place is slightly overpriced, but being located in Scarsdale, it's not THAT overpriced. If they delivered for free that would be great. Venue is more or less clean.

I got the white pizza ... Recommended and the fish taco also recommend by the waiter ... Was excellent ! ... Friendly and great beers too.... If u don't want to see a lot of kids ... Go during the week but it's not bad still worth the 4 stars ... And !! Reward points also!

The food was pretty good and the attentive staff gave great service. They were doing a very cool promotion when I went, that resulted in some free food. Nice family place, and very comfortable setting.
I live close to this place..  Heard a lot of good comments.. Now I understood, those comments make real sense.. Its delicious..,

Simply fantastic!! The customer service is amazing, they are so accommodating and make you feel at home w/every visit. I've never had an issue and if I could, I would be here every night. The food is great and cater to all needs. I have a picky son and they never give me a problem for changing the dish. I love this place!  Great for groups couples and families with small children. What a gem!

I  Went for a lunch with a couple of my co-workers, the server is very fast and the place look very lovely.  I had the original BBQ Chicken Pizza after ordering, it came out around 10 minutes and it was very good. It was not the best pizza I've had, but I will say that is on the top 5 pizzas I have eaten.  I can highly recommend it, with their legendary BBQ sauce some smoked Gouda, red onions and cilantro they know how to transform the original to iconic and delicious. This pizza had a great and delicious taste.

Had a horrible experience two weeks ago. My server was Perry. This guy was completely miserable. You can sense he didn't want to be there. Me and my friend was very nice and respectful. We asked if we can use the CPK rewards for the bill and he got completely upset and violent. He told us we could not. And he grabbed the bill so violently from my friend that he almost knocked  both our waters down. The table literally shook. This guy was so mean and disrespectful. He has no customer service skills whatsoever. He never came to our table to ask how we were doing or how was the food. He never asked if we wanted refills or more bread. This was by far one of the worst experiences I ever had eating out. I do plan to go back because the food is always good. But I will make sure that Perry doesn't serve my table again. .....I really hope this reaches the manager.

Today was disappointing as far as awful service is concerned.  Food was good standard CPK fare, but for the price you'd think our server would be accommodating.  It wasn't even busy at lunchtime today.

The food and presentation at this place is very good. I gave a three because the service initially sucked. But our server Maria was great it wasn't her fault.  So, the hostess sat us down promptly with menus. For the next 15 or so minutes we sat unattended. No small plates, no cutlery, no water, no one take our order, or drinks.  After asking a different server for help, she Maria came. Maria helped us download the restaurants app which got us a free small plate. She knew the entire menu by heart and explain the restaurants guarantee (which means if you're not entirely satisfied with your food you don't have to keep it you can swap it for something different).  The food was good. We all had pizza. We are a family of six, but today only 5 were dining. 4 of us had the bbq chicken pizza and one had the chipotle chicken pizza. I choose to get my bbq chicken on gluten free crust. Smh never again. Pizza is not pizza that way. The chipotle was the bomb, but very spicy!!!! The avocado rolls were awesome too, but if you don't do pork, let them know cause it has bacon.

This CPK is the worst one I have been at.  The place is very dirty with a nasty, filthy carpet that smells.  A five year old could clean and set tables better.  There is always food debris under the tables - always.  Consistently though, staff excel at being loud, very loud, and milling about at the counter or by the pizza oven while discussing their personal lives.  Who cares!?  Try cleaning the dump.  Additionally, there is ever present loud music blaring ( not loud enough to drown out the immature staff though).  This is a shame because I have eaten at other CPK locales which are clean and nicely run.  Anyway - I have given up on this particular CPK - way too dirty.

Went for late lunch today. Not many people so my service was fast. It could have been a little cleaner and the carpet smells terrible. I will go back again and probably sit outside to eat since the food is really good.
Delicious, upbeat and fairly priced - basically my favorite local restaurant. Every last item tastes incredible and plus after that you can go next door and play with baby cockatiels in Bird Jungle!!
Just literally left this place and couldn't wait to write a review. I've been to different CPK locations numerous times and this was by far the worst.

Been to this CPK location several times. The service could be a hit or miss. But for the most part the servers are friendly! The location could use an industrial carpet cleaning especially towards the back of the restaurant. This is a place to go for a CASUAL outing with friends and family. You often see many families with kids dining.  As for the food, many options for dining in addition to pizza and pasta dishes. Price point is fair but a little more costly than most other chain restaurants of this type. My recent trip I had a salmon entree and butter cake both were awesome. However, didn't bother to look at the calories for the butter cake - enough said. This is a go to spot for me when in the area running errands and need a quick bite to eat.

Currently here eating, the service was great. Although they put too too much sour mix in my friend's Long Island iced tea they replaced it know he's happy :) I'm drinking a margarita it's delicious. Haven't been this place in awhile be in glad I came back. Ordered the BBQ chicken pizza delish & my friend ordered the avacado egg rolls which are super good. Would totally recommend this place

I just had a birthday party for my granddaughter in the Scarsdale, NY CPK.  It was great, the food was excellent and the best was a waitress named Maria who was in charge of our party.  She treated us like family and made us feel totally at home.  We were a large party, but she met our needs in a consistently pleasant and accommodating way.  It was great and she was such a big part of making the party fun.  Her patience was remarkable.  Everyone had a good time and the food was generous and very good.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone.
I came here for the first time last night with my son. Pleasant experience. The waitress was great. Food was top notch. No complaints. I will be back again soon!

The place has recovered!!! The food here is great. However, their service used to be TERRIBLE but now it's okay but still on the slow side. The prices are good. It's a good place for a quick lunch or something. We were regulars before their service fell into a hole but glad we tried it again!

Yes it's a chain restaurant but the food is always on point and the staff is awesome. Although it's a chain, you can see (literally due to the open kitchen) that everything is made fresh in house. How many restaurants, let alone a chain restaurant, can claim that? Their fire roasted salsa is amazing. They use it on several dishes but tonight I had the salsa on the carnitas tacos. Delicious and really 2 nice sized tacos. The menu is varied with tons of healthy/vegetarian options. CPK has a rewards program too! Tonight I got a free Tiramisu :)  Come here, you will be treated well.
Food and sangria was amazing first time experince here... i will be back and the waiter was also amazing polite and on point...
There was plastic in my salad. Very gross. Pizza not bad though. Not to sure if I will give them a second chance.

Awful. We ate their with our 2 daughters following a painting class in the plaza. To start the service was non existent and when our server did stop by she was rushed, unpleasant and unkempt.  Our order was mangled. Keep in mind we ordered 3 small pizzas no toppings. They screwed it up and gave us 3 pizzas with toppings and 2 had meat! We are vegetarians. They server basically said, "we're busy." Came back 30 minutes later with 3 new pizzas (1 was uncooked in the middle).  Parents, avoid. Take the kiddies to any of the plethora of good local pizza shops. This is a frozen pizza chain with bad service.

Always liked the concept of California Pizza Kitchen. I tried many different locations, and I always loved their food. People may think that this is a Pizzeria, when it is actually much more than that. They have different dishes, and it can be the place for the whole family.  Mostly the service is provided by a professional waiter, who I can tell love and take their job very serious. Restaurant (Not a pizzeria) for the whole family, with reasonable prices, and good service. If you have reasonable expectations, you will love it here.

So disappointed on all levels.  Felt like we were invisible and thus ignored.  We didn't even get water till main meal came out.  Drink order was wrong.  Just seemed like the whole establishment didn't care.  Oh well...it WAS a fun place...no more.
Flies flying freely around us. Doesnt smell very clean either. Maybe it is ammonia solution? Not as good as it once was.

What a terrific establishment. Our girl scout troop came here for an end-of-year party. Our host, server and tour guide Icoka was so friendly and fun with the kids. They all had a fabulous time. We had a tour of the kitchen - the entire facility was clean and organized. The pizzas were delicious. I would not hesitate to recommend this place for an adult or kids party, or for any meal.

Not sure what's happened throughout the years but this location is just.. terrible. It reeks outside so sitting outdoors is not the smartest move, the service is non existent but take advantage of it if you have a desire to feel invisible one evening, and the food isn't worth the price. Definitely never being coerced to come here again..

Came here yesterday for the first time around 7pm with my husband, father, and daughter and I have to say we all enjoyed our experience there . It was our first time there and we were unsure of what to expect. From the moment we entered the restaurant we were greeted and seated immediately, our waiter Perry I believe was his name was AWESOME . He was patient with us and suggested a few things to pick out . I never had to ask for a refill for water . He was on his A game and provided the best customer service .  What really got me was that when my daughter had lost her crayons , he did not hesitate to give her another pack . Because of him I will be returning and recommending this place !

I ordered my food before I left work.They told me  the price and  the time  to pick  it up .When I entered  the female at the register was helping  another customer.Once she was finished she went back to the register and helped  a couple who came in after me.While she was helping  the first customer  she looked at me and never acknowledged  me,never asked me what I needed.I left and never got my order.

This place used to be good until their portions became tiny. Every time I order there's less and less food on my plate. As portions decrease, prices increase. Their pizza is all crust too and extremely salty. Not coming back even though I live down the block and have been a customer for 10+ years.

Stopped in for lunch today with the family.  Very nice place - atmosphere, quick and friendly service, great food, and reasonably priced.  Server explained all to us (yes we were newbies!!) and she was very patient.  We had great personal pizzas... And she had a Cobb salad.  Meals were all customized ... Tweaked by us... I highly recommend this place and we will be back!!

Had a nice lunch (guacamole n chips, two kids pizza and a wild mushroom pizza for me), my first time at CPK. We downloaded the Pizza Dough rewards app (after our server told us about it) and got the guacamole n chips free. Our server Maria was very friendly and efficient and included the kids in the conversation. The kids enjoyed the brownie with whipped cream and the ice cream sundae for dessert from the kids menu. A nice meal and we will be back to check out other items on the menu.

The food here is good. Some delicious things to try are of course the pizza, salads (some are very tasty), avocado egg roll, sesame ginger chicken dumplings and their pasta dishes. They make some surprisingly good pasta for a small place.  Definitely worth giving them a try. :)

Been awhile since I ate here last and after this visit it will be my last. After being seated we waited over ten minutes with no server. We left. On the way out the hostess (a large woman) made a snide comment, "Have a nice night." Have to say there are so many better choices on Central Avenue One doesn't have to accept sub par service or rude employees.

(I never write reviews that are anything less than positive, but first time for everything..?)  Let me start off with the fact that our waiter was kind & was frequently checking up on us, so from my experience, the service was okay.  However, okay service doesn't help the fact that the food was below average. We ordered three pizzas and one appetizer. The appetizer, the Spinach & Artichoke dip, was a gloopy microwaved mess with bland chips. The Fresh Tomato & Mozzarella was alright. Decently textured mozzarella cheese with each bite. The BBQ pizza was alright as well.  However, this was all ruined by this weird, funky salad pizza thing. The sauce did not taste good and there was too much lettuce on top & not enough of the other toppings. I've been here a few times over the past 5 years and each time, the food has never been that good to me. Maybe I have always ordered the wrong things? Anyway, there are way better restaurants on Central Park Ave and way better CPK restaurants in other locations.
Great little spot for pizza and other selections on the menu. They have a fantastic array of Sangria and the service is always fantastic.

I've been coming to this location for years - it's always been one of my favorite go-to casual restaurants. That said, I've been recently been noticing a disturbing trend re: quality and quantity. The last few visits, I've ordered one of the many pizzas on the menu. What was once a great personal pizza has become a comical facsimile: First and foremost, the pizzas themselves have gotten smaller, and anyone who says differently is not paying attention. Second: The actual "pizza to bread" ratio has taken a nosedive. To explain, look at the circle of pizza from above. The "content" of the pizza has gotten closer and closer to the middle of the circle, and the outer "crust" area has gotten lager and larger. As a result, you have a circle of dough with a barely passable central section of actual food. Lastly, the amount of featured toppings has decreased noticeably: For example, whereas the garlic chicken pizza used to have a bunch of chicken and other toppings all over the pizza, now there's a few chicken scraps and a topping or two strewn about haphazardly on the cheese. Of course, despite all of this, the price has remained the same! Now, it's not all negative: The service and atmosphere has remained consistently good throughout the years, and the soups and some salads are still decent. I know some people will comment that I should "expect" that restaurants have been offering less and less for your dollar over the last few years, but this is no excuse, nor should it be an "acceptable" practice. (I mean, I stopped going to Outback Steakhouse on a regular basis because their serving became so tiny it was laughable -- their bloomin' onion is half the size it used to be).  I certainly hope the owners here realize they're getting lazy/cheap, and get back to the former "glory" that made them a great place to eat!.

I'm not usually wowed but yesterday I was! The server - Maria made sure we understood everything on the menu. She made sure we joined the CPK rewards program and made tons of suggestions because we were overwhelmed. She was very welcoming and LOVES her job. Maria was so genuine and nothing about our interaction was forced. I always passed CPK but never stopped in and boy have I been missing out. This place is so homey for a "chain" and the level of hospitality is outstanding. The menu and food exceeded my expectations. The manager formally came over and gave us some chocolates and a voucher for a free small plate for our next visit. They knew we were new and wanted to make sure our stay was exceptional. I will be a frequent diner here!

This is the kind of place you can always count to be consistent. My wife and I have been coming here for years and have never left unsatisfied. Avocado egg rolls are an easy choice to start and always come out hot and delicious in a timely manor. The pizza we usually save for takeout, but their entrees are out of this world! Chicken piccata never disappoints, and the Jumbalaya fettuccine will warm your bones on a cold winter day. The staff makes you feel like you're at home, very friendly and truly care about your dining experience.
Food and device are phenomenal. Always have a great experience there when I go. Bartender Jessie makes the best drinks and he is pleasant and attentive even though the place is constantly busy!

Never been to one of these places. They did a great job with a kids birthday party.  They were so accommodating. I brought my daughter to a birthday party.  The kids had a blast. They got to make their own pizza. The staff put out salad and pizza for the adults. They had Chef aprons, coloring books, etc. it was a very nice set up

Come on mothers day and the wait was only 10 minutes!!  started with the spinach artichoke dip which was served nice and hot with chips, one downfall is the chips are verg very salty.  The warm bread and olive oil is amazing. the olive oil mix has a great flavor of spicies.

Today is Lauren's first day serving and she is wonderful. She went out of her way to double check our rewards would work. I've interacted with her before when she's hosted us, but I really enjoyed having her serve us even more!
Great drinks (I recommend the Peggyrita & the Blueberry Ginger Smash.) The Spicy Buffalo Cauliflower is really delicious but need to ask for well done.
Not the greatest service nor the greatest food. The server was rather unprofessional and took a while to take our orders and the food was eh.

After trying their frozen pizzas I decided that the real thing is probably worth a shot. I was surprised by the ambiance of the whole place before going I thought it would be like Panera Bread but, it isn't. It's a sit down restaurant.  Me and my boyfriend ordered the spinach artichoke dip and mushroom pizza to share. Service was very fast and the waitress was really nice and helpful. The dip was weird, it had some kind of tang to it. Could of been cheesier and cheaper. We didn't finish it and we are not ones to back out of spinach artichoke dip. The mushroom pizza had lots of mushrooms but, once again lacked cheese. I enjoyed it but, I wasn't wowed...the amount of flour on the crust was insane. We didn't get the truffle oil because $1.50 on a $15+ pizza... Overall I'd have to go back and try other items from the menu. I think it's overpriced and could use some improvements.

What a horrible experience with this restaurant. First time my family and I went, the pizza was tasteless and they did not give us what we asked for. NO ONIONS on the pizza! The second time we went, we waited for 15 minutes for the waiter to come and take our orders. The waiter came and took our order and when the food came out, the only thing that tasted decent was my child's mini pizza. That was it, we agreed that this will be the last time we go to this California Pizza place.

Comparing this branch with that of our favorite branch in Manhattan I would say this has a simpler ambiance but gee the staffs are the top of my list of nicest and attentive servers. The Murray Hill branch is our favorite branch but I remember when it gets so busy the attitude of the staffs back there changes to less pleasing. In Scarsdale, its the other way around. The food they serve in here is what you typically expect in a CPK... good pizza, salad and pastas. Nothing really fancy. This is not a fine dining italian place anyways. I'm just please because of the good attitude of the staffs and the cleanliness of this branch.
